com.topcoder.util.idgenerator
Class IDGeneratorFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.util.idgenerator.IDGeneratorFactory
public class IDGeneratorFactory
extends java.lang.Object

This class has two factory methods which produce implementation of IDGenerator for callers. Currently, there are two kinds of implemtation for IDGenerator: IDGeneratorImpl and OracleSequenceGenerator.

This class stores references to the instances which it returns internally, so that the same instance is always returned for the same sequence name.

Version:
3.0
Author:
srowen, iggy36, gua

Method Summary

          Retrieves an implementation of IDGenerator for the named sequence, creating it if necessary.

           Retrieves a specific implementation of IDGenerator for the named sequence, creating it if necessary.  The desired implementation is specified by passing in a fully-qualified classname.  The class must implement the IDGenerator interface.  If this parameter is null, then the default implementation will be instantiated if a new generator needs to be created.

Method Detail

getIDGenerator

public static IDGenerator getIDGenerator(java.lang.String idName)
                                  throws IDGenerationException
Retrieves an implementation of IDGenerator for the named sequence, creating it if necessary. If an instance already exists for the sequence then that instance is returned instead of a new object.

Parameters:
idName - name of desired ID sequence
Returns:
an instance of IDGenerator for the named sequence
Throws:
NoSuchIDSequenceException - if name is null, or no such ID sequence is configured in the database
IDGenerationException - if an error occurs while retrieving ID sequence configuration (for example, database errors)

getIDGenerator

public static IDGenerator getIDGenerator(java.lang.String idName,
                                         java.lang.String implClass)
                                  throws IDGenerationException,
                                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                         java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                         java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                         java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                         java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

Retrieves a specific implementation of IDGenerator for the named sequence, creating it if necessary.  The desired implementation is specified by passing in a fully-qualified classname.  The class must implement the IDGenerator interface.  If this parameter is null, then the default implementation will be instantiated if a new generator needs to be created.

If an instance already exists for the sequence then that instance is returned instead of a new object, provided it uses the requested implementation. There is also a possibility of an implementation clash which occurs when two different calls to this method request generators with the same name but different requested implementations.

Parameters:
idName - name of desired ID sequence
implClass - class name of desired ID sequence
Returns:
an instance of IDGenerator with the given idName and implClass
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if implClass cannot be loaded
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if error occurs while get constructor from the class.
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if error occurs while reflecting the class
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if error occurs while new instance for arguments reason
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a generator with the requested name already exists but uses a different implementation
java.lang.InstantiationException - if there was a problem instantiaing implClass
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if there's a security problem instantiating implClass
IDGenerationException - if an error occurs while retrieving ID sequence configuration (for example, database errors)
